issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

components.name: eucanetd
components.description: Used to track component level items associated with Edge.

fields.description:
Curl attempts are timing out in specific CI and manual VPC tests. 
The test (in CI; bfebs-test & create-image test) attaches a 2GB EBS volume to an instance and attempts to download(curl) a remote image writing to this volume/disk. In my tests, curl is reporting download speeds of <2mb/sec. and eventually stops downloading all together around 300-330mb. 
- I tested dd'ing into the volume from one local device directly to the block dev associated with the attached volume and saw speeds of 10-20mbs. 
-I attempted to curl the same image to /dev/null on the instance and noticed the transfer would get further but would eventually hang at about 1.2gb. 
-The block device reports that it is 2gb in size. 
- I was able to curl the image remotely to my laptop w/o an issue. 

Example where /dev/vdc is the device associated with the attached 2gb volume on the instance...
{code}
curl http://images.walrus.cloud.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/precise-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img > /dev/vdc
{code}

Topo/Env info below. Mido gw on the UFS host...

{code}

fields.summary: Downloads hanging while writing to EBS backed volumes in VPC mode

comments.body: Odd that behavior would be different in VPC.
Hey, [~mclark], is this still reproducible? If not, perhaps let's close?
I am not seeing this in my more recent setups. I'm going to close this out. I'll re-open if I can reproduce.
